title: Spacecoco neon start/menu animation, HUD + scoring/elimination revamp, brighter VFX, and audio polish (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Upgrade Home + Lobby start experience to a high-motion retro-cartoon neon animated presentation while keeping Spacecoco name and navigation intact
acceptanceCriteria: Home screen and/or Lobby screen includes a clearly animated scene (not just a static image) featuring moving UFO/alien elements and cow eye-laser effects.
All user-facing text remains in English (existing headings/buttons remain understandable and consistent).
Navigation to Lobby/Play/Skins/Leaderboard continues to work as before.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable animated start-scene component (retro-cartoon neon) that renders moving UFO/alien fly-bys and cow eye-laser bursts using the generated splash/banner + sprite-sheet assets; keep the game title and CTA slots available for existing copy. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace the current mostly-static hero section background/hero image usage with the new NeonStartScene (keeping the SPACECOCO title text and existing navigation buttons intact and understandable in English). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add the NeonStartScene (or a lighter-weight variant/prop configuration) as an animated banner/hero backdrop for the Lobby screen while preserving existing lobby controls and copy in English. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add global utility classes for neon glow overlays and performance-friendly animation helpers used by the animated start/menu presentation (no changes to user-facing text).

requirements.summary: Revamp the in-game HUD to a modern arcade retro-neon style with large readable digits and purple/red/blue/green accents
acceptanceCriteria: Score and Level are displayed with larger, more prominent typography than the current HUD.
HUD styling is neon/retro and uses the requested bright palette (including purple/red/blue/green).
HUD remains readable against the playfield (no low-contrast text over bright effects).

file_operations.description: Redesign HUD layout and styling: larger score/level digits, stronger neon contrast, and clear grouping; incorporate purple/red/blue/green accents while keeping the same displayed information (Score, Level, Planet, Gravity).
Add neon text styles (e.g., glow/shadow utilities) to ensure large HUD digits remain readable over bright gameplay visuals.
Extend Tailwind theme with additional neon utility tokens/animations (focused on purple/red/blue/green accent usage) needed for the updated HUD styling.

requirements.summary: Update scoring to award points for eating objects and for eliminations, with clear on-screen point-gain popups that do not obstruct gameplay
acceptanceCriteria: Eating at least cows and penguins changes the score in a clearly visible way (HUD updates and an on-canvas or overlay popup appears).
When an elimination event occurs (see competitive rule requirement), the winner receives a clear points reward and an on-screen popup indicates the gain.
Score feedback animations do not block gameplay visibility (brief duration, positioned sensibly).

file_operations.description: Add/extend types to support score feedback popups (position, amount, color/style, lifetime) and elimination score events while keeping existing game types compatible.

Adjust gameplay scoring logic so points are awarded on eating (at minimum cows and penguins) and on elimination wins; push score feedback popup events into state with brief lifetimes and sensible positioning so gameplay visibility is preserved.
Implement rendering for floating neon score popups (e.g., +150) with short animation and glow; ensure popups are readable and fade out quickly without covering the playfield.
Ensure HUD + canvas VFX feedback remains visible together (no overlay conflicts) and that mute/pause UI continues to function with the updated scoring feedback.

requirements.summary: Add competitive elimination rule: body-on-opponent-head eliminates the opponent (reset to starting size) and spawns collectible point drops for growth/score
acceptanceCriteria: A head-vs-body collision between two snakes triggers an elimination event for the head owner (not a full match reset).
The eliminated snake respawns/resets to the normal starting size as defined by the game initialization rules.
The elimination produces collectible point items on the playfield, and collecting them increases the winner's score and causes additional growth.

file_operations.description: Extend game state types to represent at least one opponent snake, elimination events, and dropped collectible point items (including metadata needed for scoring and growth).
Add constants for elimination rewards, drop counts/values, and respawn/reset behavior while keeping existing systems (planets/modifiers, bosses, spawning, crocodiles, power-ups) intact.

Implement opponent snake simulation (sufficient to trigger head-vs-body collisions), detect body-on-opponent-head elimination, reset eliminated snake to INITIAL_SNAKE_LENGTH, spawn collectible point drops on the playfield, and apply score+growth when drops are collected.
Update rendering to draw opponent snake(s) distinctly from the player (e.g., tinted/glowing treatment) while preserving readability and performance.
Add rendering support for the new dropped point items (collectibles) so they are clearly visible and consistent with the neon style.

requirements.summary: Increase perceived gameplay visual quality with brighter neon post-processing-like effects (glow/trails) while preserving performance and readability
acceptanceCriteria: Lasers have a visible trailing/glow effect compared to the current thin beam rendering.
Overall gameplay presentation is noticeably brighter/neon without obscuring hazards, snake, or collectibles.
Game remains responsive (no obvious stutter introduced by the new effects) and core mechanics remain intact.

file_operations.description: Enhance laser rendering with glow/trail treatment (web-feasible canvas techniques such as shadow blur/compositing and brief trail persistence) and incorporate neon spark particles where appropriate.
Register/load the neon spark spritesheet asset for UI/VFX accents and ensure it can be drawn efficiently during gameplay.
Adjust render loop to support subtle trailing/motion persistence in a performance-friendly way (without obscuring hazards, snake, or collectibles) and keep core mechanics unchanged.
Tune canvas/container styling (e.g., subtle neon glow around the canvas) to reinforce the brighter 'expensive' look while maintaining contrast and clarity.

requirements.summary: Upgrade audio polish: higher-quality SFX and add cinematic feedback (e.g., stereo feel/filters) while keeping Play mute behavior working
acceptanceCriteria: The existing mute toggle on PlayPage continues to mute both music and SFX.
Laser firing and cow-eating SFX are upgraded in quality and remain clearly audible with appropriate mixing.

At least one additional cinematic-feel audio enhancement is present (e.g., positional panning on laser, filtered explosion tail, or dynamic volume shaping) without breaking browser autoplay constraints.

file_operations.description: Upgrade SFX playback to support higher-quality assets and at least one cinematic enhancement (e.g., stereo panning for lasers and/or filtered tails on explosions) while preserving throttle behavior and fully respecting the existing isMuted flag.

Trigger additional gameplay feedback SFX events as needed (e.g., elimination, point-drop pickup, explosion moments) and pass enough context to enable spatial/cinematic mixing without impacting gameplay performance.
Keep the current mute toggle behavior intact across music and SFX with the upgraded audio system; ensure no new autoplay-breaking behavior is introduced.
Add improved high-quality laser firing SFX asset (used by the updated SFX system).
Add improved high-quality cow-eating SFX asset (used by the updated SFX system).
Add an explosion/elimination-impact SFX asset to support stronger cinematic feedback (used by the updated SFX system).

requirements.summary: Include new retro-cartoon neon static art assets and sprite sheets under frontend/public/assets/generated and wire them into the start/menu and in-game VFX
acceptanceCriteria: New images/sprite sheets are present under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced via correct absolute paths (e.g., /assets/generated/...).
The start/menu presentation uses the newly generated assets (not placeholders).
No backend endpoints are introduced for serving images.

file_operations.description: Add generated retro-cartoon neon splash/hero illustration asset for the upgraded start/menu presentation.
Add generated wide retro-cartoon neon banner asset for Home/Lobby animated presentation.
Add generated UFO/alien fly-by sprite sheet for menu/start animation.
Add generated bright cow eye-laser firing sprite sheet for menu/start animation.
Add generated neon glow particle/spark spritesheet for UI/gameplay VFX accents.
Add edited high-contrast neon-cartoon hero image replacing the previous hero art for compatible use in layouts where a static fallback is needed.
Wire the new generated assets into the animated start scene (splash/banner backgrounds + UFO and cow-laser sprite sheets). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update Home hero to reference the new generated assets (including the edited hero image as a fallback) so the start/menu presentation uses non-placeholder art. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the new neon spark spritesheet is loadable via the sprite manager and referenced via the correct absolute path under frontend/public/assets/generated.
